Near2001: We must get to that lab...
Talk_1081:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>But for now, Josha's investigations are
my main priority.<sp:5:0:0>

So until she gets further along, I'll be
staying here for a while.
Talk_74:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>What?! <sp:5:0:0>You already found it?


<sp:3:0:2:0100>I'd expect nothing less from you.


That <clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>will still be invaluable.
It's the product of my brilliance, after all.
I'd expect nothing less from ME.
Talk_1082:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>People have been saying the princess has
been sighted in the castle, but I have a
hard time believing that.
Anyway, Purah's on top of that. She'll be
looking into the castle herself.

<sp:3:0:2:0001>I intend to look for clues regarding the
princess using my OWN methods.
Talk_75:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>My design of the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff> is beyond
perfection!<sp:0:4:0>Just listen to its sounds and you'll find
your way to that nearby <clr:0000>shrine<clr:ffff>.
Talk_1083:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm interested in where Josha's research
is headed.

So I'll stay here a bit longer.
Talk_76:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>When the <clr:0000>Shrine Sensor<clr:ffff> responds, then
there should be a shrine nearby.

More precisely, it'll react <clr:0000>when you are
moving in the direction of a shrine<clr:ffff>.

If it's not reacting stably, try <clr:0000>changing the
direction you're facing<clr:ffff>.
Talk_1084:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_00>Come on!<sp:5:0:0> Act more impressed!


<sp:3:0:2:0801>I'm the first one in ALL of Hyrule who
noticed the shrines after the Upheaval.
So I created a <clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>to detect them!
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_00>Only thing is, I can't set it up here at
Lookout Landing.

It'd be nearly impossible unless I'm
at the <clr:0000>Purah Pad Research Lab <clr:ffff>in
<clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>.
Talk_1085:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Great job getting the picture of the <clr:0000>figure<clr:ffff>
that Josha was looking for! She was pretty
happy to see that statue.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>And I was thrilled to show you how to
use the <clr:0000>camera<clr:ffff>. Inspired, even!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>The Purah Pad has even more potential
functions, you know.
Talk_78:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>OK, that wraps up my chatting about it.<sp:5:0:0>
Try testing out the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>Hm?<sp:5:0:0> That's odd.<sp:5:1:0>


The <clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>reacts <clr:0000>when you're moving
toward a shrine<clr:ffff>...

There's a shrine in the cave at the
bottom of this hill. But the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff> isn't
reacting to it whatsoever!
Talk_1086:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hey, you!<sp:5:0:0> Listen up!


Now that Josha has solved the mystery
of that slate...

<sp:3:0:2:0800>I can return to the <clr:0000>Purah Pad Laboratory<clr:ffff>
in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>!

If you go there, I can make even more 
improvements to your Purah Pad, starting
with the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>You'll find the lab in East Necluda, off in
the southeast corner of Hyrule. On its
far side is Hateno Village.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Go a bit farther than that and you'll see a
mighty peculiar place. Don't let the looks
fool you. It's a cutting-edge lab!
Talk_79:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>WHAT?! <sp:5:0:0>You found it?


<sp:3:0:2:0100>I'd expect nothing less from you.


Anyway, how about that <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>? <sp:5:0:0>Handy,
huh? I'd expect nothing less from ME!
Talk_0001:
Need to get inside? Come find me at
Lookout Landing near Hyrule Castle.
                                                  -Robbie
Talk_82:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>All right! Now that I've installed that
<clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff> for you...

How about you walk around the lab to
test out how it reacts?
Talk_1073:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Listen up! Big update here.


Your Purah Pad can be equipped with a
<clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>that <clr:0000>detects shrines<clr:ffff>.
Talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey, you!


The Purah Pad Laboratory is ready for us
to do some great things together! First,
let's get that <clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>up and running.
Come on, let me see that <clr:0000>Purah Pad<clr:ffff>.
This will only take a moment.
Talk_83:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>Now you begin to see the true potential
of the Purah Pad!

But I'm nowhere NEAR done yet.
I created new features for that device
while I was waiting here for you.
Yes! I whipped up some <clr:0000>prototypes<clr:ffff> of
these extra features and can get them
on your Purah Pad at any time!
That is, with some help from you,
getting some final data I need in order
to activate them perfectly.
Let's talk if you want those upgrades.
Enjoy that <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>—a taste of great
things to come. <sp:5:0:0>Until then!
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>I knew you'd be dying of curiosity over
the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>.

Follow me, would ya?
Talk_1074:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughL>That's right. It's a lab dedicated to the
enhancement of the Purah Pad, which
Purah and I developed.
Once I'm in that lab, and you join me
there, I can further <clr:0000>improve <clr:ffff>your Purah
Pad, <clr:0000>starting with the sensor<clr:ffff>.
You'll find the lab in <clr:0000>East Necluda<clr:ffff>, off in
the southeast corner of Hyrule. On its
far side is <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>.
Go a bit farther than that and you'll see
a mighty peculiar place. Don't let the
looks fool you. It's a cutting-edge lab!
Talk_84:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What's the problem? Do you need help
with the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0701>It'll react <clr:0000>when you're moving toward a
shrine<clr:ffff>. The more strongly, the more
you're pointed in the right direction!
So, if it's not responding much—or at
all—try <clr:0000>moving in another direction<clr:ffff>.

It seemed to go off more when you were
pointed toward a section <clr:0000>of the slope
outside<clr:ffff>. Try going right down there!
Talk_1075:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>The Purah Pad will prove to be absolutely
essential for finding the princess! I'm sure
of it.
So, you'll want the pad upgraded to be
of even MORE use, starting with that
<clr:0000>shrine sensor<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>But I can't do it at Lookout Landing,
not with the meager equipment we have
on hand here.
Even with my genius for these things,
I need to upgrade it at the <clr:0000>Purah Pad
Research Lab <clr:ffff>in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>.
Talk_85:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>We need to finish <clr:0000>testing<clr:ffff> your new
<clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>. Come back here, will ya?!
Talk_1076:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I really appreciate you fixing up my
balloon.<sp:5:0:0> Ultra thanks!

That "Autobuild" thing is pretty
darn amazing.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Hmm, I should have a good think about
all the practical uses of that someday.<sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Oh! That reminds me...<sp:5:1:0>
Talk_86:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hey, you! How long you gonna make
me wait?
Talk_18:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0800>Done-zo!<sp:0:2:2:6400>


<sp:3:0:2:0701>Now this <clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>will make a sound if
there are <clr:0000>shrines<clr:ffff> near you.
Talk_87:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We're still testing that <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>, so hold off
on the rushing around for now.<sp:0:4:0>Just <clr:0000>walk <clr:ffff>in the direction you're moving<clr:0000>
when you hear the sensor react<clr:ffff>.
Talk_1078:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>All right, I'm going to head over there.
I'll be waiting for you to arrive.

See you in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>! Don't keep
me waiting!
Talk_73:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>What's this? The <clr:0000>sensor <clr:ffff>that I installed
on your Purah Pad is reacting to
something—right here and now!
It reacts <clr:0000>when you're moving toward
a shrine<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>The <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff> must be detecting a shrine
down the slope in front of the lab. Is there
really one THAT close by?
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There must be, because my creations
are perfect.<sp:5:1:0> Unless they get broken in
some way.
Now, why don't you go check <clr:0000>down the
slope<clr:ffff>, in the direction that the <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>
was indicating?
